dt: {bc}something spoken or written in reply to a question
{bc}a reply to a legal charge or suit {bc}{sx|plea||}

dt.t: His only {wi}answer{/wi} was to walk out.

dt: {bc}one that imitates, matches, or corresponds to another

dt.t: The show is television's {wi}answer{/wi} to the newsmagazines.

pt: {sc}answer{/sc} {sc}response{/sc} {sc}reply{/sc} {sc}rejoinder{/sc} {sc}retort{/sc} mean something spoken, written, or done in return. {sc}answer{/sc} implies the satisfying of a question, demand, call, or need.
{sc}response{/sc} may imply a quick or spontaneous reaction to a person or thing that serves as a stimulus.

pt.t: a {it}response{/it} to the call for recruits

pt: {sc}reply{/sc} often suggests a thorough response to all issues, points, or questions raised.
{sc}rejoinder{/sc} can be a response to a reply or to an objection.

pt.t: a salesman with a quick {it}rejoinder{/it} to every argument

pt: {sc}retort{/sc} implies a reaction to an implicit or explicit charge, criticism, or attack which contains a countercharge or counterattack.

pt.t: she made a cutting {it}retort{/it} to her critics

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}andswaru{/it} (akin to Old Norse {it}andsvar{/it} answer); akin to Old English {it}and-{/it} against, {it}swerian{/it} to swear {ma}{mat|ante-|}{/ma}
shortdef: something spoken or written in reply to a question
a reply to a legal charge or suit : plea; also : defense

dt: {bc}to be or make oneself responsible or accountable
{bc}to act in response to an action performed elsewhere or by another

dt.t: The home team scored first but the visitors {wi}answered{/wi} quickly.
an old bucket {wi}answered{/wi} for a sink
The school had to {wi}answer{/wi} for a town hall.

dt: {bc}to speak or write in reply to
{bc}to say or write by way of reply
{bc}to reply to in rebuttal, justification, or explanation

shortdef: to speak or write in reply
to be or make oneself responsible or accountable

dt: {bc}to know the solution to every problem

dt.t: He thinks he {it}has/knows all the answers{/it}.

shortdef: to know the solution to every problem

dt: {bc}to reply to someone especially in a rude way

dt.t: impolite children who {it}answer back{/it} when their teacher corrects them

shortdef: to reply to someone especially in a rude way
